context: The Finnish word 'ollut' is the past participle form of the verb 'olla', which means 'to be'. It can function as an adjective meaning 'having been' or serve in various compound tenses. As a past participle, it's used to form perfect tenses with the auxiliary verb 'olla' (have/has been). The word appears in compound constructions like on ollut (has been), oli ollut (had been), and olleet ovat olleet (they have been).
